required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study of TQB3824 in Subjects With Advanced Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of TQB3824 in Subjects With Advanced Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: TQB3824 blocks function of a specific protein called Cell Division Cycle 7 (CDC7) kinase in the human body, which plays important roles in the maintenance of DNA replication forks and DNA damage response pathways. This study will evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of TQB3824.

primary_outcome.description: DLT describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.
The maximum Dose at which less than 33% subjects experiencing DLT
RP2D will be based on evaluation of clinical safety and tolerability and guided by accumulating PK data

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC)
Time to reach maximum(peak )plasma concentration following drug administration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to Reach the Maximum Plasma Concentration
The sum of percentage of participants with complete response rate and partial response rate
percentage of participants with complete response (CR), partial response (PR) plus stable disease (SD)
the time from the date of first documentation of a CR or PR to the date of first documentation of tumor progression
Time from the first dose to the first documentation of PD or death from any cause, whichever occurs first
the time from start of study treatment to date of death due to any cause

arm_group.description: TQB3824 tablets orally administrated orally on Days 1-21 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Dose escalation of TQB3824 will be based on evaluation of clinical safety and tolerability and guided by accumulating PK data

intervention.description: TQB3824 is a CDC7 inhibitor, which plays important roles in the maintenance of DNA replication forks and DNA damage response pathways.

facility.name: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institution & Hospital
